data.name: Funny algorithmic task
data.description:
Write a function which would take two figures as a parameters and generate List of numbers which would contains figures from 1 fo `size` and lenght of each number should be equals to `size`.

Then return number at `position` (1-based).
If number at that position doesn't exist return -1;

Ranges:
- `$ 1 \le \hbox{size} \le 9$`
- `$ -10^9 \lt \hbox{position} \lt 10^9 $`

Examples :

```haskell
Generator(2, 3) => 11, 12, 21, 22
                            ^
should return 21            ^
```

```haskell
Generator(3, 10) => 111, 112, 113, 121, 122, 123, 131, 132, 133, 211, 212, 213, 221, 222, 223, 231, 232, 233, 311, 312, 313, 321, 322, 323, 331, 332, 333
                                                                  ^
should return 211                                                 ^
```

Good luck :)
